page.title: 19ENERGY.C.E.G.B.BOLNEY.
page.content: Bolney Substation is a high voltage Substation on The National Grid Network.It has a Control Room which is manned 24 hours a day controlling circuits to populated areas within the locality.Power can be transferred to Brighton and Worthing if there is a shortage of Generation at Brighton Power Station.The Substation was set up in the 1960s.It covers 24 acres. There are 4x400Kv.circuits.10x132Kv. circuits.4 supergrid transformers. The station serves most of Sussex and parts of Kent and Surrey. It supplies 1 million homes.It handles enough power to run 15 million one bar electric fires in one day.27 people work there on operations and maintenance.
